item.description:
Art Deco is one of those architectural styles recognizable to most Americans. Lavish and eclectic, Art Deco geometric shapes conjure images of a streamlined technological age reflected in the emergence of skyscrapers, aviation and telecommunications through the 1920's and 1930's. While many look to other cities like New York and Miami for Art Deco in architecture, Boston retains a rich collection and some of the finest examples in the country.

From the Batterymarch building through to the Paramount Theater, join us on this walk and discover many hidden treasures in Boston's financial district on the Boston By Foot Tour of the Month.

This guided walking tour leaves from Angell Memorial Park in Post Office Square (near the corner of Milk & Congress Streets) at 2pm. This tour is $15 ($6 for Boston By Foot members).
item.how_to_find_us: Near the corner of Congress & Milk Streets.
item.name: Art Deco in Boston
